purpose: To restore normal service operation as quickly as possible and minimize adverse impact on business operations, thus ensuring that agreed levels of service quality are maintained.
description: An incident is an unplanned interruption to a service, or reduction in the quality of a service. The primary objective of incident management is to restore normal operations as quickly as possible with the minimum possible impact on either the business or the user, at a cost-effective price.

key_concepts.incident_definition: An unplanned interruption to a service, or reduction in the quality of a service
key_concepts.major_incident: An incident with high impact and/or high urgency
key_concepts.incident_model: A repeatable way of dealing with a particular category of incident
key_concepts.workaround: A method to restore service or reduce impact when a full resolution is not available

scope: Events that may lead to incidents
Communication with users about service disruptions

key_activities.description: Detect and record incidents from various sources
sub_activities: Receive user reports via service desk

key_activities.description: Classify incidents and determine handling priority
Perform first-level diagnosis to understand the incident
Transfer incident to appropriate support level or management
Detailed technical investigation to identify root cause
Implement solution and restore service operation
Formally close incident and ensure satisfaction

key_metrics.measurement: Total resolution time / Number of resolved incidents

key_metrics.description: Percentage of incidents resolved at first contact
key_metrics.measurement: (Incidents resolved at first contact / Total incidents) * 100

key_metrics.description: Number of incidents in a given period
key_metrics.measurement: Count of incidents by time period

key_metrics.description: Average resolution time segmented by incident priority
key_metrics.measurement: MTTR calculated separately for each priority level

integration_with_practices.problem_management: Identify underlying causes of recurring incidents
integration_with_practices.service_desk: First point of contact for incident reporting

success_factors: Clear incident categorization and prioritization scheme
Regular review and improvement of processes
common_challenges: Inadequate incident categorization leading to misrouting
Poor communication with users during resolution
Lack of integration between tools and processes

norwegian_context.language: All incident communications should be in Norwegian
norwegian_context.regulations: Compliance with Norwegian data protection laws
